programme.desc: During the Middle Ages, the Vikings were infamous for being a bloodthirsty band of seafaring warriors. Is it possible that they were not the savage brutes we think of today - but rather, a highly advanced civilisation?

programme.title: Ancient Aliens: Origins
programme.desc: The Great Pyramid of Giza remains one of the ancient worlds most captivating mysteries, with compelling evidence suggesting it may have functioned as an ancient power plant.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: The first snowfall of the Winter blankets the entire meadow, and Little Nutbrown Hare is confused because he can no longer see the bush, the log or his seedpod ball under all the snow! Will Little Nutbrown Hare be able to find his way around the meadow now that all his familiar places are covered under a blanket of fresh white snow?

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: On a snowy Winter’s morning Little Nutbrown Hare and Little Field Mouse are amazed at the intricate patterns they find in the snowflakes, each one different from the others. The friends try to take one to show Big Nutbrown Hare, but they always melt before he sees them. Will they find a way to stop the lovely flakes from melting?

programme.title: Learning Time With Timmy
programme.desc: It’s dressing up time and Timmy plays Doctor! Poor Teddy is sick, can you help Timmy put some plasters on Teddy to make him better?

programme.title: Hurray for Huckle!
programme.desc: The kids find some numbered papers blowing around the park. After investigating several possibilities of where they could be from, they finally figure out they were once fastened to trees in the park as part of a self-guided tour to celebrate Arbor Day. / When all the milk in Huckle’s Dad’s store turns out to be sour, Huckle, Sally and Lowly set out to find out why.

programme.title: Messy Goes To Okido
programme.desc: In the real world, Messy is running around. He runs so fast that he can feel his heart beating loudly! Why is that happening all of a sudden? When you need to know, go to Okido! Messy lands in Okido onto Zoe and Felixs trampoline. They all jump off, and they notice all their hearts are beating loudly but they don’t know why... Zim and Zam will know though, so off they go to see them. Zim, Zam and Zoom are baking a cake. Zim startles as they enter the lab, he was whisking so fast that his cake mix flies out of his hands and lands all over Zoom!

programme.title: Messy Goes To Okido
programme.desc: In the real world, Messy is having fun on his swing. Back and forth he goes but suddenly it breaks! A disappointed Messy goes off go to Okido to find out why! He lands in Felix and Zoes garden but cant see them anywhere. To Messy’s surprise, out they jump from behind something strange… “Where did these metal trees come from?” Messy asks them and discovers that they arent trees, theyre legs! In fact, theyre legs of Stan Tall, Okidos biggest robot who is helping Zim build a bridge today. So Messy whistles the Okidoodle over and they race Stan to the seaside to get started!

programme.title: Strawberry Shortcakes Berry Bitty Adventures
programme.desc: The twins birthday is approaching. Sour says she does not wish to share the birthday with Sweet. Sweet is sad that her sister feels that way but respects her wish. Sour initially enjoys having a birthday of her own and the activities the Berry girls plan for her, but gradually feels lonely without her sister, and regrets what she said earlier.

programme.title: Harry And His Bucket Full Of Dinosaurs
programme.desc: Harry is disappointed to find that he is not able to join in with any of the activities his family are taking part in at home.

programme.title: Harry And His Bucket Full Of Dinosaurs
programme.desc: When Harry is told to tidy his room he simply transfers all the mess into Dino-world, where he is told there is a no tidying up rule.

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: On a beach in Indonesia, Zari finds tide pools littered with rubbish and a stranded bamboo shark in one of the tide pools. In the Garden, Leo is engrossed in a cricket hunt but finds the cricket on top of a slide which Hero tries to climb up. They get a call from Zari as she tells them about the shark and its inability to climb up the tide pool wall. As they arrive, Leo attempts to scoop the shark out, but the shark ends up slipping away. Katie recalls that bamboo sharks can crawl on their fins. The team fills the tide pool to facilitate the sharks escape, only to encounter another hurdle—rubbish-filled tide pools blocking its way to the sea. Ranger Rocky intervenes, and calls Ranger Joey who shares insights into the bamboo sharks ability to survive out of the water for long periods of time. The team cleans the tide pools, ensuring a safe passage for the bamboo shark back to the sea. Back at the treehouse, Leo hangs a picture of the bamboo shark as Hero slides down the slide with the cricket on his head.

programme.title: Thomas And Friends
programme.desc: Thomas is working in Brazil when he hears exciting music hes never heard before - batucada! Thomas is pulling cars/trucks that make great percussion sounds when he rolls along. So, when Thomas meets a batucada band, he is invited to start the carnival with his noisy trucks that biff and bash along to the beat. Later on, when hes dropped off the cars/trucks, Thomas is worried that he wont be able to join in with the batucada band. But then something helps him remember how he can take part!

programme.title: Thomas And Friends
programme.desc: Diesel resents being scolded when he makes a mistake, and takes advantage of Rebeccas good nature.

programme.title: Grisu
programme.desc: Some sheeps escaped from Mr. Guellecs field. The farmer is torn as he cant watch the herd and fix the broken fence which allows the sheep to run away at the same time.Its a perfect mission for Grisu who will learn to be a shepherd, with Stellas help. But the task isnt a piece of cake since the sheep dont want to listen to him at all. They rush away throughout the streets of Dragontown, causing troubles. Grisu and Stella have to discover how to steer a herd, especially a stubborn black sheep. Not an easy mission but as ever, a fire fighter never gives up!

programme.title: Grisu
programme.desc: The Dragon Stone, a beautiful and rare stone that Grisus ancestors found centuries ago breaks accidently. It was supposed to be the main stone of an exhibition that Professor Smeraldo has set up. To avoid cancelling the exhibition, Grisu, Fume and Stella go to explore a cave where they might find another legendary Dragon Stone. But the expedition turns into an adventure when they realize that only the two kids are able to go through the very small entrance of the cave. The quest quickly appears to be a big task for such young kids, even if one of them is a dragon. But thanks to their tenacity (fire-fighters never give up!), Grisu and Stella will be able to find the legendary stone and to find their way back. The exhibition will be saved!

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Among the newly fallen Autumn leaves Little Nutbrown Hare finds a very peculiar little, hairy, green… ‘something’. Intrigued by what it might be Little Nutbrown Hare asks all his friends, but they all have different answers! It is certainly a very useful ‘something’, great for back scratching and games but it takes Little Grey Squirrel to solve the mystery.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: One bright moonlit Autumn night, the Nutbrown Hares are both having trouble sleeping. As they lay quietly in a pile of leaves they listen to the sounds of the night… swish, hoot, wobble, nibble, croak and splash! They go on a journey to discover what’s making the interesting night noises, but will they work out what sound the moon makes?

programme.title: Chuggington Badge Quest
programme.desc: To earn their badges, the trainees must go all day without speaking – but there’s a little room for error, as they’re each given three ‘lives.’ Wilson loses one of his lives when he shouts out during a Safari Park tour, chasing away the animals and spoiling the tour. He learns that by concentrating and breathing deeply he can control his need to make noise. Not only does he earn his badge, he gets the extra reward of seeing loads of wonderful animals that only come out when it’s quiet!

programme.title: The Fox-Badger Family
programme.desc: Grandpa Fox has disappeared! The entire family is searching forhim. To lighten up the mood, Scoutbadger and Woodsy say how amusing it is that Grandpa Fox is so distracted. But Rosie gets angry: she won’t allow them to make fun of her Grandpa who has contracted an illness… the illness of forgetfulness. Rosie knows that her beloved Grandpa forgets more and more things,and that’s the problem! He could forget the way back home to the burrow…

programme.title: Bob the Builder
programme.desc: JJ and Mila are training for a snowboarding stunt show to be performed at the opening of the Winter in Spring Festival - a celebration of winter in Spring City. Bob and the team will be building a triple chairlift to transport passengers to the top of Observatory Hill. But Bob isn’t keen on the cold weather - he’d much prefer to be building sandcastles on the beach! During a work break, Skye offers Bob a snowboarding lesson - and he’s terrible! Meanwhile, Scoop is determined to have a slide down the snowy hill - but Wendy warns him that without snow chains, he’ll have no control. Scoop can’t resist... and ends up sliding all over the slope and crashing into a support beam, causing the chairlift cable to jump off the wheel tracks.

programme.title: Bob the Builder
programme.desc: Bob and his crew are finishing off the new penguin pool at Spring City Zoo. It’s almost complete when Lofty accidentally drops a large rock, which smashes the observation window. It’s urgent that they fix it quickly because the penguins will be arriving any moment. Meanwhile Mayor Madison and Mr. Bentley are entertaining a special visitor, the grouchy Mayor Snipe from Riverdale. They take him on a tour of the city, but he isn’t impressed with the castle, the sports stadium or the revolving restaurant.Back at the zoo the penguins have arrived, but the pool isn’t ready for them yet. Leo has been busy working on a new pond and water feature at The Town Hall, and Lofty suggests the penguins can stay there until their new home is ready.

programme.title: Hurray for Huckle!
programme.desc: Trying to figure out what a strange piece of metal with a number 10 on it is, Huckle and his pals take it to Blacksmith Bear who helps them discover strange writing on it. Figuring it must be a foreign language, they take it to Ms Honey and, with her help, determine the piece of metal is a lost tap from Hilda’s French tap dance shoes./Huckle and pals set out to find the whistle blower who is causing a traffic jam.

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: A barn owl scares Leo in the garden. The Junior Rangers depart for the grasslands to find a better hunting place for the barn owl.

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: Leo comes across a baby Asian elephant while planting an apple tree. To find the elephant’s mother, the Junior Rangers explore the lowland forest.

programme.title: Simon
programme.desc: It’s Lou’s birthday. At school the day before, Simon overhears her saying that the present that she has always dreamed of is a rainbow-colored-butterfly-unicorn-kitty! Of course they don’ exist but Simon is determined to make one for her with some help from Mom. What a wonderful birthday present to offer Lou! It turns out perfectly, it’s beautiful and boy is she going to be happy! Simon and Mommy take the bus to go to Lou’s birthday party.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: Alfonso, the cricket, finds a strange little fish in the stream, which turns out to be a lost polliwog. Although Alfonso is sad when the polliwog returns to its frog family, their friendship doesnt end. Alfonso visits his tadpole friend every day, who soon develops into a real little frog.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: During a big storm, lightning strikes the lookout tower, setting it ablaze. Berry, Dolly, and their friends immediately alert the firefighter beetles. The brave firefighters arrive quickly, extinguish the fire, and save the tower from greater damage. The little team works together to repair the roof, and Eddy installs a lightning rod to make the tower safer. At the end of the day, everyone thanks the heroic fire beetles.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: Berry, Dolly, and their friends watch slides and then play a lively game of shadow puppets. They continue the game in front of a rock wall, forming funny shapes. Bubble, the little rose beetle, gets scared by the strange shadows on the wall, thinking a giant monster has moved into the forest. Luckily, Christopher, the canary, helps clarify the misunderstanding. Bubble and Christopher join the fun shadow play.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: Eddy, the potato beetle, notices he cant see well from a distance, so on Dollys advice, he visits Dr. Owl. Eddy needs glasses, so he and Dolly visit Fly Flynn, the optician. Eddy is delighted to rediscover the joy of sharp vision and can finally see the birds lively concert clearly.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: Bubble is peacefully resting in the meadow when a bored cloud playfully pours rain on him, making the rose beetle angry. When Bubble tries to catch the cloud, he gets hurt. The cloud regrets its prank and apologizes. To make amends, it offers to fly Bubble over the forest, who happily waves to his friends from above. By the end of the adventure, the cloud and Bubble become good friends.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: The owl chicks dont understand why the mirror copies them. Mama Owl brings them a new mirror but accidentally places it opposite the old one, so the little owls marvel as they multiply in it. Doctor Owl securely attaches the new mirror in the nursery, where the chicks can play and have fun.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: Berry, Dolly, and their friends spend the afternoon playing hide and seek. Berry hides so well among the water lily petals that he falls asleep and drifts away on the water. Luckily, the Moon Beetle and the Moon itself help him get back home. The next day, all the little friends play a big game of hide and seek together in the meadow.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing builds a house out of sofa cushions and Coco decides its perfect for a game of Big Bad Wolf. Bing enjoys being wolfie until hes not allowed into the house he built.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: It’s a hot day and Bing and Flop buy an ice lolly from Gilly the ice cream lady. Before they can eat them a frog hops into Bing’s paddling pool and they go to the rescue. By the time they return to the ice lollies all that’s left are the sticks and a plate of lolly goo.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing gets very enthusiastic when he and Sula paint a mural and his painting starts to drop all over Sulas. Sula is upset until she realises that the painting isnt spoiled, its just different.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing gets stuck when he takes a game of hide-and-seek too far.

programme.title: Tilda Appleseed
programme.desc: Tilda is a clever and intelligent mouse who lives in a tiny house at the base of the church wall with her pet Snaily and her best friends.

programme.title: Tilda Appleseed
programme.desc: Tilda finds a bottle containing a treasure map in the stream. She excitedly shows Rupert her discovery and the two go on a treasure hunt. They turn Wild Rose Lane on its head, but theres no treasure to be found. After hours of searching in vain, the pair recover with a tasty picnic in Tildas garde, where Tilda finally decodes the complicated map.

programme.title: Tilda Appleseed
programme.desc: Tildas Great Great Aunt Emily is visiting Wild Rose Lane. Rupert suggests they have a competition to decide which of the two mice bakes the better cheesecake. While Emily sets to work in Ruperts kitchen, Tilda discovers an old recipe from her ancestor Eusebia which sounds better than her own.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Days On a hot Summer’s day Big Nutbrown Hare wants the young ones to have some relaxing time by the river. Like most young kids they have trouble staying quiet and still. When they do finally manage some quiet time, they experience the variety of life that the river has to offer, including some rare birds and a family of terrapins.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Little Nutbrown Hare wakes up to a colourful sprig of holly in the snow outside the hollow log. It’s surprise gift from Little Spotty Deer, who has returned to the meadow. This gives Little Nutbrown Hare and Little Field Mouse the idea to spread the joy and surprise all their other friends with a holly sprig too, so the three of them make a game of it. Theme: Spreading fun and joy.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Day It is the shortest day of the year so the sun doesnt rise until very late and is going to set very early. To Little Nutbrown Hare everything feels mixed up and theres no time to do all the things he wants to do. That’s until he and Little Field Mouse name it Topsy-Flopsy Day and decide to make a fun and funny day of it!

programme.title: Simon
programme.desc: Simon learns to roller skate, which turns out to be harder than he thought. As Lou and Ferdinand have skated before, Simon thinks they must be super roller skaters!.

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: When a Sunda slow loris lands in the garden, the Junior Rangers quickly learn that they have to return it to the wild. Will they manage to find the slow loris a home? Or will the slow loris end up as a snack for a hungry sun bear?

programme.title: Chuggington Badge Quest
programme.desc: Badge Quest is a series in which Wilson, Brewster and Koko attempt to earn a badge. Almost every character from the first season is featured in these episodes.

programme.title: Chuggington Badge Quest
programme.desc: Wilson and Koko have to feed the animals in the snow, but Wilson can’t find the sheep!

programme.title: Charley Loves Nature
programme.desc: T’choupi and Nina are planning to go on a picnic with Nina’s donkey Coquelicot but the animal is stubbornly refusing to leave its enclosure! So the two friends decide to pamper it to get it to loosen up, hoping it will then be more inclined to move! But it’s no good: the nervous donkey simply refuses to budge an inch!

programme.title: Charley Loves Nature
programme.desc: This morning, T’choupi notices that the pretty drawing Lalou sent him through the mail has been chewed! But who’s the culprit?! Nina argues that none of her animals could have done it but T’choupi is certain it’s one of the pets at Nina’s house. And he’s determined to find out which one! He gets a surprise when he finds out that the little nibbler is not a usual suspect!

programme.title: Charley Loves Nature
programme.desc: T’choupi, Nina and Mom are busy sowing seeds in the small vegetable garden. But a bird keeps coming along and pecking them up as soon as they’ve been sown! So T’choupi and Nina decide to build a scarecrow to protect the seedbeds. They go about it in secret (although with Dad’s help) to give Mom a nice surprise. However, they get a disappointment when they realize their scarecrow isn’t scary at all!

programme.title: Charley Goes To School
programme.desc: Its an adventurous day: a chest with mysterious contents is hidden somewhere in the school... Charley and his friends disguised as pirates go on a treasure hunt! But the school is vast, full of forbidden corners and unexpected encounters...

programme.title: Sam And Julia
programme.desc: Julia is angry with Sam who stepped on her tail. Sam hurt her and she lost her balance. Julia doesnt want to talk to him anymore! As best he can, Sam tries to make up with his friend.

programme.title: Sam And Julia
programme.desc: Suspecting that each others life would be suits them better, Sam and Julia swap places for a few hours. But is Sams life really funnier than Julias? And her life calmer than Sams?

programme.title: Sam And Julia
programme.desc: Arriving from a faraway island, Julia the little mouse moves into a new home with her mother. There she meets Sam, another young mouse whos long lived with his parents and a whole gang of brothers and sisters. They quickly become inseparable and enjoy a host of fun adventures together.

programme.title: Thomas And Friends
programme.desc: Cleo is shocked to learn snow does not last forever and tries to stop it from melting. But will her mission to save the snow be successful?.

programme.title: Thomas And Friends
programme.desc: When Thomas finds out that the Earls Technology Fair will bring new inventions to Sodor, he sets out to prove that steam engines are the best inventions ever.

programme.title: Caillou’s New Adventures
programme.desc: Caillou and the Super Friends use their powers to save their ball from the Master Thief!

programme.title: Caillou’s New Adventures
programme.desc: Caillou faces a fierce dragon that tries to steal his spaghetti!

programme.title: Hurray for Huckle!
programme.desc: Forgetful Mayor Fox has misplaced the giant key to the city that hes supposed to be presenting to a visiting astronaut. Huckle and his pals try to figure out where he set it down. They learn that Mayor Fox did one thing while touring a candy factory that required both his hands - stirring a huge pot of candy goo. Not far away they find a big chocolate-covered key./When Busytown residents are baffled by mysterious door knocking, Huckle and gang discover who it is.

programme.title: Monkey See Monkey Do
programme.desc: What could be more annoying than losing your banana exactly when you are hungry? Well not to worry, Monkey has asked his best friend the dog to help him. As dog looks for the banana, monkey has another great idea, that they play his favorite game… “Monkey See Monkey Do”!

programme.title: Monkey See Monkey Do
programme.desc: Our amazing Monkey attempts the impossible; juggling 4 snow balls. But the snow balls keep disappearing… It is the seal playing tricks on his old friend! Well, every friend that comes to visit is an opportunity to play Monkey’s favorite game… “Monkey See Monkey Do”!

programme.title: Fireman Sam
programme.desc: At the garage, Joe, Hannah, and James try to point a giant laser beam at the moon to measure how far away it is. Norman worries they’ll lead Moon Men down to Pontypandy, putting everyone in danger… but it’s his panic that ends up causing a fire!

programme.title: Fireman Sam
programme.desc: Mandy wants to be the fastest delivery person ever! Her dad upgrades her scooter, and she speeds through her deliveries… until she hits a bump, loses her brakes, and needs to be rescued before she gets to the cliffs!

programme.title: Franklin And Friends
programme.desc: Franklin struggles with making the “perfect” sculpture for Aunt T’s found-object sculpture garden -- until he learns to “see” his, and everyone else’s, sculpture in a different light. /When Franklin and Bear - not cooperating well - lose a badminton doubles challenge and are forced to walk around three-legged style for an entire day, they have no choice but to finally learn how to really work together as a team.

programme.title: The Fox-Badger Family
programme.desc: Rosie, Scoutbadger and Woodsy bit off more than they can chew! They have picked so many plums that the Fox-Badger family will never be able to eat them all before they rot… Margaret asks the children to find solutions to avoid such a waste. Our three little heroes first think of giving them away to the neighbors, but there’s still plenty of plums left.

programme.title: Doodleboo
programme.desc: Surely, we all want to become great! Bubble wants to, as well, to be great to be able to create the most beautiful choreographies of the world! Doodleboo knows something that proves that, with a little patience, things become even more majestic!

programme.title: Doodleboo
programme.desc: Playing in the rain and in the mud is always funny, but afterwards, one must clean their clothes, and Sketcky, he does not know how to do that. Who could help him?

programme.title: Doodleboo
programme.desc: Sketcky, disguised as a Sioux, does not hold up: he dances, sings and wants to go on an adventure! But it’s impossible to go for a walk, because it keeps raining. Doodleboo then has a little idea: he knows the secret of the great Indian chiefs for rain and good weather...

programme.title: Ruff Ruff, Tweet And Dave
programme.desc: Ruff-Ruff, Tweet and Dave bake a carrot cake for the Little Bunnies to help them say thank you to their Mom on Mother’s Day, for being such a great Mom. Following Hatty’s special recipe they seek out all the right ingredients, check the quantities they need and mix them all up in Hatty’s magic hat to make the perfect bake!

programme.title: Ruff Ruff, Tweet And Dave
programme.desc: Ruff-Ruff, Tweet and Dave are excited about going to school to learn new things. When the teacher fails to show up, Hatty invites Ruff-Ruff, Tweet and Dave to take it in turns at being teacher themselves. They have fun sharing facts about dogs, birds and bananas, and by the end of the day are amazed by how many interesting things they already knew!

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Little Nutbrown Hare is disappointed when a trail of ants disappears with the delicious Spring berries he’s found. He’s convinced that ants are not very nice, and only after Big Nutbrown Hare explains how the ants were probably taking the berries home to their families does Little Nutbrown Hare forgive them. And when he sees how clever the ants are, he soon wants to be like them.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: The Summer meadow is home to a many amazing treasures of nature. When Little Nutbrown Hare finds a beautiful blue butterfly, he and Little Field Mouse go on a hunt for other blue treasures to bring back and show Big Nutbrown Hare, including blueberries, blue bells and even blue eggshells. Meanwhile, Big Nutbrown Hare has discovered the biggest blue treasure of them all. What could it be?

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Little Nutbrown Hare wakes early one Summer morning before the sun has risen. Big Nutbrown Hare sends Little Nutbrown Hare off to invite his friends for breakfast so he can rest a little longer. Along the way Little Nutbrown Hare discovers how wonderful and different all his friends homes are. Will Little Nutbrown Hare still love his own home as much as he did?

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Charlie is coming to play and Bing has planned lots of things for them to do. But when Charlie arrives he doesn’t want to play any of the games Bing has put out. Bing is upset until Flop suggests they watch to see what Charlie really wants to do. Charlie heads straight for the kitchen where he, and Bing, have a great time making music with pots and pans.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing and Flop see Pando skateboarding and Bing wants a go but its a lot harder than it looks and Bing falls off. Pando finds a clever way to help Bing get his confidence back.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: At Ammas crèche a butterfly lands on Sulas painting. Bing tries to help it go outside but accidentally squishes it. Flop and Amma help the sad children say goodbye.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: The playful rabbit wants to draw a big picture, so Flop finds him some chalk to create a stripy, spotty, zig-zag dinosaur on the pavement

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing and Sula find a potato in Amma’s vegetable patch with a comical ‘face’, so they take it under their wing, naming it “Nosey”. The two children look after Nosey and show him around the crèche but unfortunately Nosey goes down the slide too quickly and his ‘nose’ falls off. Amma shows them how to plant both bits of potato so that they can grow new potatoes.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: The green Grub wants to stay with Dolly for the winter, but always finds her at the wrong time with the request. The Wind accidentally blows the The Green Grub to the seaside, then brings it back to Dolly. Finally, Dolly happily welcomes the Green Grub for the winter and prepares a comfortable bed for him.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly 05 Mepe
programme.desc: Berry the snail and Dolly the ladybird are the best friends ever. They have many adventures, while they make new friends and get knowledge about the world around them.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: The inhabitants of the forest hold a baking contest to celebrate the arrival of summer, but Dr Owl goes overboard with tasting. With the help of Beetle Bodobács, they manage to save the evening with chimney cakes and dancing. The next day, Dr Owl apologizes and improves his mood with a group workout.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: On a rainy day, Dollys house gets flooded. When the rain stops, Stanley, the stag beetle, repairs the roof. Berry also helps Dolly, who is upset about her soaked drawings. Berry visits Raymond, the copper beetle, who has plenty of bells. He asks for two special bells to cheer Dolly up. At home, he makes coconut balls and later delivers them to Dolly along with the bells, which make her very happy. Later, Berry paints over the stain caused by the rain, and Dolly repaints the pictures with the help of Flutter and Leapy. The bells bring joy to the house.

programme.title: Hurray for Huckle!
programme.desc: A mysterious giant circle appears in the middle of a corn field. Although Pig Will and Pig Won’t are convinced it’s the landing site of an alien flying saucer, Huckle puts the clues together and ultimately goes up in a hot air balloon to reveal the flattened area is actually Vincent Van Goat’s latest artistic endeavor./When flying potatoes are dropping from the sky in Busytown, Huckle and gang are determined to find out why.

programme.title: Monkey See Monkey Do
programme.desc: Monkey is sitting and looking up at the full moon when he hears a howl makes him jump into Parrots hammock! Mole explains that the howl is a way for the wolf to communicate with other members of its pack.Just then we hear a different howl which sounds very near. It is coming from a wolf cub. Monkey decides to bring the cub back to its pack in the tundra.

programme.title: Fireman Sam
programme.desc: Professor Pickles leads Hannah, Sarah and James on an epic quest to find the Ancient Pontypandy Way. But when it gets dark, he makes a flaming torch and accidentally sets the forest on fire!

programme.title: Fireman Sam
programme.desc: Norman tries to finish his Sea Life Spotting project but ends up stranded in a cave by rising tides. Sam pilots Juno to rescue him just in time.

programme.title: Kate And Mim Mim
programme.desc: When Kate’s ant farm breaks, she wonders how to get the ants back in their home. In Mimiloo, Lily has found hatching humming turtle eggs! Cowgirl Kate must find a way to round up the baby humming turtles and lead them to their mama in the Singing Seas.

programme.title: Kate And Mim Mim
programme.desc: Kate gets frustrated playing mini golf in the back yard. In Mimiloo, it’s Make-Up-A-Game Day, so Kate helps her friends combine the best parts of their favourite games to make up a brand new game! Mim-Mim really wants to win his very first trophy—but first, Kate will have to help him find his strengths to master the game.

programme.title: Charley Loves Nature
programme.desc: While looking for a lost toy under a bunch of crates, Nina and T’choupi discover some very strange hairs belonging to some unidentified animal … In a mystery, the two friends head off to inspect all the animals of the hamlet in an attempt to track down the owner of the strange fur... But a big surprise awaits them…!

programme.title: Charley Loves Nature
programme.desc: Blindfolded, T’choupi is having the time of his life playing Blind Man’s Bluff with Nina and Luce!... Until he falls over… right in the nettles! Owieee! His parents tend to his little booboo, but he’s not so keen to play all of a sudden - he’s scared he’ll fall in the nettles again! When his parents spur him on, T’choupi gives in and resumes playing. But his motivation has been dampened: now he’s scared of everything!... But wait, T’choupi’s no scaredy-cat, and he’s gonna prove it!!

programme.title: Sam And Julia
programme.desc: Sam and Julia dream of seeing snow falling in the yard of the Mouse Mansion. They decide to do everything they can to make this happen. But such a thing is not so simple, as they will find out!

programme.title: Sam And Julia
programme.desc: Arriving from a faraway island, Julia the little mouse moves into a new home with her mother. There she meets Sam, another young mouse whos long lived with his parents and a whole gang of brothers and sisters. They quickly become inseparable and enjoy a host of fun adventures together.

programme.title: Tilda Appleseed
programme.desc: It’s National Hugging Day! All the friends hug each other, except for Rupert. Tilda knows there’s something wrong! Rupert is afraid his spines could hurt anyone. But Tilda already has an idea.

programme.title: The Triplets
programme.desc: 24 days seem like a very long wait until Christmas. But the Triplets may have an idea to speed up time. What if they ate all the chocolates from their Christmas calendar at once? Of course, Mom is not happy and warns them: they had better be good, because Santa is watching and doesn’t bring gifts to kids who do not behave! Oh no, they only have three weeks to make up for a whole year of silly things!

programme.title: The Triplets
programme.desc: Shh! Let’s not wake up Mom! Today is her birthday and the Triplets have decided to prepare her a surprise: a nice cake with a poem and a beautiful necklace! But it is easier said than done and the kitchen is soon covered in flour and cocoa powder. They eventually decide for a breakfast in bed. After all their efforts they discreetly go into Mom’s room with the tray. But suddenly, Bang! The entire homemade breakfast falls on Mom’s bed. What a great way to start the day…

programme.title: The Fox-Badger Family
programme.desc: In the morning, Rosie discovers that its Grandparents Day,which she had totally forgotten! But Grandpa and Grandma Fox are coming for dinner and she is intent on making a gift for them. She decides to create a show with the help of her sister, her brothers and Edmund. It will be The Three Little Badgers. Alas, nothing goes as Rosie hoped. The show is soon at risk, as Edmund, who was supposed to play the Big Bad Hurricane mustleave to help Casimir fix a collapsed dam.

programme.title: Caillou’s New Adventures
programme.desc: Caillou is worried theres a monster under his bed, so Daddy checks to make him feel better!

programme.title: Caillou’s New Adventures
programme.desc: Caillou and his friends tell spooky stories at a sleepover!

programme.title: Thomas And Friends
programme.desc: Christmas is fast approaching and it is the last chance for children to post their letters to Santa. Percy is collecting the mail, but there is a lot of snow on the rails and it isn’t easy to get through. Harold teasing Percy doesn’t help either, but when Percy runs into a snowdrift it is Harold who volunteers to take the letters for him. Percy is cross at having to be helped, but when Harold doesn’t come back it is Percy who goes to find out what happened and help him in return.

programme.title: Chuggington 03
programme.desc: Border Bridge is re-opening - and Wilson has been given the special job of using the new rolling reporter car to make a live report, which will be broadcast on Vee’s boards all over Chuggington. Wilson takes the car out to practise and comes across Calley training Hoot and Toot. When an emergency call comes in, Calley asks Wilson to look after the twins. They offer to help Wilson practise his report - but instead, they run off with the camera car and end up lost in the ice cave. Happily, the camera is transmitting - so, using Vee’s boards, Wilson is able to track them.

programme.title: Chuggington 03
programme.desc: It’s another glorious day in Chuggington and Zephie is keen to enjoy the sunshine, but every job she is given is underground. Meanwhile Speedy is out in the countryside serving drinks with the juicer wagon, when he’d rather be doing a proper job at the depot. They agree to swap jobs. While trying to operate the juicer, Zephie accidentally knocks a beehive out of a tree.

programme.title: Charley Goes To School
programme.desc: Its an adventurous day: a chest with mysterious contents is hidden somewhere in the school... Charley and his friends disguised as pirates go on a treasure hunt! But the school is vast, full of forbidden corners and unexpected encounters...

programme.title: Ruff Ruff, Tweet And Dave
programme.desc: Ruff-Ruff, Tweet and Dave put on a show for Hilda the Cow, to thank her for all her hard work down on the farm. They make up a play about Hilda planning a dance party for all her friends and choose costumes, props and sound effects to help tell their story. Tweet directs the action, Ruff-Ruff plays Farmer Fred and Dave stars as Hilda the Cow. Despite some mishaps the show is a triumph and Hilda is inspired to throw a real party!

programme.title: Doodleboo
programme.desc: What amazing thing can we do with a coin? Doodleboo explains how to draw a Pig

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: Jayden, strolling along the riverbank in a wetland forest, discovers a beaver trapped under some rocks in the river. Attempting to rescue the beaver, Jayden gets his prosthetic leg stuck in the mud, and both he and the beaver become stuck. Meanwhile, in the garden, Leo and Katie build a tall tower of blocks, but Heros playful antics cause the tower to collapse. Jayden calls to let them know of his situation with the beaver. Leo and Katie head to the treehouse to learn more about the American Beaver. Armed with information, the Junior Rangers, along with Hero, rush to the wetland forest to rescue Jayden and the beaver. After a challenging rescue involving lifting rocks with jetpacks, they free the beaver. However, the beaver appears distressed, a call to Ranger Joey lets them know that beavers use tail slaps to signal danger. Danger came soon enough when a bear approached. Leo comes up with a clever plan involving PlatypusOne distracting the bear while Leo, Jayden, and Hero keep the beaver company. With Ranger Rockys help, they bandage the beavers tail and find its family. In the treehouse, Leo hangs a photo of the healed beaver, while below, Katie builds the tallest tower yet and Hero’s tail causes it to topple but it remains standing.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: In February, the little friends gather for a carnival party and agree that there wont be a costume competition. Instead, the girls dress up as vegetables, while the boys dress up as fruits. However, Katie, the yellow ladybird and Snail Sam are not aware of this arrangement. So when they burst into Vendes house where the ball is taking place, everyone teams up to creatively transform their costumes. The friends enjoy the celebration, which is made complete by a large basket of colorful carnival donuts. On their way home, they admire the first snowdrops.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: The five girls are getting ready for a spring welcoming party, where they will perform a spring dance. They share their plan with the mushrooms, who are thrilled and offer their hats. Rosita, the rose beetle promises to return them, but Berry puts the hats back incorrectly. Rosita puts them back in the correct order and, as an apology, the girls also present their dance to the mushrooms

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: In April, the Pigeon post brings the ants a bouncy castle. Its Dr Owls task to invite everyone for the jumping session, but Berry is nowhere to be found. Hail interrupts the jumping fun, but the friends seek shelter in the ant castle. The toy gets damaged, but with the help of a cloud, Berry can also join the jumping. Then the ants rebuild the castle, and everyone happily continues jumping.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: Balthazar and Stanley are building a raft that gets carried away by the stream. They end up far from home, but then decide to head back during a storm. Christopher, the canary helps them, but they fall off during a gust of wind. They find refuge in a hollow to rest where they are finally discovered and helped to go home by the Spider. The next day, they play along the stream again, but they no longer worry if the raft run away.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: Flutter, the butterfly girl, tries to bake an apple pie, but unfortunately, it doesnt turn out well. With the help of a fairy, she manages to fix it and then finds a lost marker and repairs the window as well. The Lily Fairy discovers that Flutter solved everything on her own and then moves on to help others.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing and Sula help Amma to get lunch ready. Bing watches yummy peas and delicious carrots go into the pot, but when lunch is served theyre all mixed up together and Bing doesnt like it.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing falls in love with a lost dog he and Flop find in the park and decides he wants to keep her. When the owner turns up Bing is very upset when it comes to saying goodbye to his new friend.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: When the children make Eggy heads with eggs and cress seeds, Bing gets impatient and wants his cress to grow quicker so he decides to give Eggy lots of water with the garden hose.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: The bunny gets jealous when Sula gives Pando more attention on a playdate. He tries to gain some for himself and ends up being pushed, so Amma show them how to get rid of the anger

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Nuair a tha Bing a’ cluich geama le fòn-làimhe Flop, chaneil rudan a’ dol mar bu chòir oir tha am fòn-làimhe a briseadh nuair a tha e dol na sgeing air an làr. An àite seo innse do Flop, tha Bing ga chuir dhan bhiona. Tha e faireachdainn cho dona mun seo ach tha e ag ionnsachadh gum feum e innse mar a thachair. When Bing is playing a game with Flop’s mobile phone, he accidentally drops the mobile and it breaks. Instead of telling Flop, he throws it in the bin. He feels upset about it all and learns that it’s best to tell the truth.

programme.title: Strawberry Shortcakes Berry Bitty Adventures
programme.desc: At the girls campout, Sour launches into a whopper of a yarn about the adventures she and Sweet had in the Berry Deep Dark Forest. She tries to get Sweet to participate in spinning the tale, but Sours over-the-top performance leaves Sweet behind. Toward the end, Sour graciously changes the story to pull Sweet into it, giving Sweet the opportunity to toss in an ad lib that makes a nice topper to Sours story. Sweet is thrilled when everyone applauds her, even Sour, who is impressed by her contribution and proud of her sister.

programme.title: The Fox-Badger Family
programme.desc: Rosie has agreed to lend her colored paint to Woodsy, so that he can paint a coat of arms on a pretty bark. But when she finds out that during her absence Scoutbadger has also borrowed some of her paint and emptied all the colors, she’s very unhappy! Fortunately, the twins have set about a quest to make it up to her…

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: When Little Nutbrown Hare, Little Field Mouse and Big Nutbrown Hare go up to high meadow with Big Nutbrown Hare they get caught in the mist. It’s a little scary so they hold hands and pass the time by playing guessing games. As the mist starts to lift, they see a beautiful circle rainbow around the sun.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Little Nutbrown Hare is excited because Big Nutbrown Hare has agreed to meet him later to play games. When his father arrives to tell him a storm is coming and he needs to gather food instead, Little Nutbrown Hare is hiding so Big Nutbrown Hare leaves. He searches the meadow for his father, more and more disappointed, but when he learns why Big Nutbrown Hare couldn’t play this time, he understands.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly

The rubbishtruck of the quick beetles arrives to help, taking away the remaining items and assisting in cleaning the meadow.

programme.title: Sam And Julia

There she meets Sam, another young mouse whos long lived with his parents and a whole gang of brothers and sisters. They quickly become inseparable and enjoy a host of fun adventures together.

programme.title: Sam And Julia
programme.desc: Sam and Julia have planned to play in their lair but Tonio wants to find out where it is! Noit so easy to fool him. But what if this game turns out to be even more fun than the one originally planned?

programme.title: The Triplets
programme.desc: The Triplets and Eliott play cards quietly in the living room, when they smell something burning in the kitchen. What a mess! Now Mommy’s cake is ruined! Eliott is really embarrassed, he has to bake the cake again. Mrs Gzell brings her sick cat for Eliott to nurse as shes going out. Eliott gives that important task to the Triplets. They are really excited! But between Toto, a particularly annoying fly and Imhotep who does whatever he wants, the Triplets have a lot of work.

programme.title: The Triplets
programme.desc: The Triplets are at the beach and they’d like to make a present for Mommy, a pucka-shell necklace. But it’s not easy when there are only mussels on the beach. When suddenly, Turbulent finds a gorgeous shell, he puts it against his ear to listen to the sea when surprise! The shell tickles him, it’s a hermit crab which fascinate Poet and Girl. They imagine themselves living great adventures in the deep sea with their new friend. But during their game, the Triplets didn’t realize the tide had risen. They are stuck on their rock, how will they escape?

programme.title: Chuggington
programme.desc: Hodges radiator is broken and theres no way to order another one.
